channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The next wave of AI won’t be driven by LLMs. Here’s what investors should focus on instead
item.description: The diminishing returns from each new iteration of LLMs are making it clear that we’re nearing the top of the S-curve for this particular technology.

item.title: 200 Years Later, Still Trying to Define the Midwest
item.description: From the geographic boundaries to the values and friendliness, people have debated what defines the region essentially since it was labeled the Midwes...

item.title: U.S. Indicts 2 Linked to Oct. 7 Cyberattack on Israeli Warning System
item.description: The Justice Department has accused two Sudanese brothers of cyberattacks on U.S. infrastructure as well as preventing possibly lifesaving alerts from ...

item.title: Biden Talks to Netanyahu About Sinwar’s Death and Getting to a Cease-Fire
item.description: After arriving in Berlin for previously scheduled meetings, the president said he was sending the secretary of state to Israel in the coming days.

item.title: These Michigan Voters Aren’t Exactly Undecided — They’re Cringing
item.description: Many people I spoke to seemed reluctant to admit — even, perhaps, to themselves — that they were really going to vote for that person.

item.title: The Evidence for a Big Youth Gender Gap and a Right Turn for Young Men
item.description: Young men are much more Republican than young women, the best data suggests, and may wind up backing Donald Trump.

item.title: Organic chicken producer’s collapse leaves Midwest farmers struggling to feed their flocks
item.description: Pure Prairie Poultry shuttered its Charles City, Iowa, plant after filing for bankruptcy last month.

item.title: Learning to love nuclear power
item.description: AI and carbon emissions are driving a change of heart.

item.title: What Yahya Sinwar’s Death Could Mean for the Gaza Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: The killing of Hamas’s leader may allow Israel to claim victory and agree to a cease-fire, and new Hamas leadership could be more open to compromise. ...

item.title: The Gisele Pelicot Rape Trial Hits Painfully Close to Home in This French Town
item.description: The town of Mazan, where Gisèle Pelicot was drugged and raped by her husband and strangers, has been shaken by the revelations. “It feels a bit like i...

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu hails ‘the start of the day after Hamas’ after leader Yahya Sinwar is killed
item.description: Israeli forces in Gaza killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a chief architect of last year’s attack on Israel that sparked the war, the military said.

item.title: Hamas Leader Killed in Gaza Fighting, Israel Says

item.title: The Death of Yahya Sinwar, and Execution Halted in Shaken Baby Case
There’s one ‘tremendous’ mistake people make while negotiating, top negotiator says
item.description: The "egocentric bias" is at the heart of it.
